item.title: Prime Video Casts Thor and Odin in God of War
item.content:encoded:
Two more castings have been made in the upcoming God of War series on Prime Video. One is a star of Severance. The other is a legendary actor.

As the Prime Video God of War series continues to take shape, two additional casting decisions have been announced. Deadline reports that the legendary Mandy Patinkin, known for playing Inigo Montoya in The Princess Bride, will be in the upcoming series playing Odin. Odin is known as the “All-Father.” The Ruler of the Norse Pantheon is also the father of Thor and Heimdall. It was previously confirmed that Max Parker will play Heimdall. However, we now know who will play Thor.

Thor Will Be Portrayed by a Severance Star in the Forthcoming God of War Series

Ólafur Darri Ólafsson, known for his role as the stern and violent, when necessary, Mr. Drummond on the Apple TV series Severance, will portray the God of Thunder, according to Deadline. Furthermore, the series will portray Thor as a former soldier of Asgard and Odin’s former right-hand man. He is dealing with some confidence issues and is struggling with alcohol as a means of coping.

Ironically, Ryan Hurst, the series’ Kratos, previously voiced Thor in the God of War: Ragnarök video game. It has also been confirmed that Teresa Palmer will play Thor’s wife, Sif, in the series.

Prime Video’s God of War is Already Renewed for Season 2

Without even having filmed a single episode, Amazon renewed the series for a second season. Production is expected to begin in February 2026. The first two episodes are to be directed by Frederick E. O. Toye, who previously directed the video game–to–TV adaptation Fallout.

As of now, there’s no word on when the series will premiere. Insider Gaming will continue to monitor the story and report any and all updates.

Are you excited for the upcoming show? Sound off in our official Discord server.

For more on the series, check out what Ryan Hurst has to say about his role as Kratos. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: New Backyard Baseball Game Coming This Summer
item.content:encoded:
Get ready to kid the kids to the vacant lot. A new Backyard Baseball game is coming this year.

Playground Productions has officially announced a new Backyard Baseball game will launch in Summer 2026. It’s the first new game in the Backyard Sports series since Backyard Sports Baseball 2015 for iOS and Android. With a likely release for console, it would be the first for major platforms since Backyard Sports: Rookie Rush in 2010.

Details on the game itself weren’t revealed, but Playground Productions says that information will come in the near future.

To hold over until more news comes, Playground has released Backyard Sports: The Animated Special on YouTube. The nearly 12-minute show features an all-star cast of Christopher Mintz-Plasse, Ego Nwodim, Donald Faison, Adam Pally, and more.

“In a high-energy new animated special from Playground Productions, the beloved 90’s video game franchise “Backyard Sports” returns as superstar Stephanie “Bubbles” Morgan is in crisis after losing her gotta-have-it, never-play-without-it lucky bubble gum,” the show’s description reads. “With just 30 minutes until game time, the Backyard kids embark on a wild, time-sensitive mission to track it down and save their season.” 

How are you feeling about a new Backyard Baseball game coming in Summer 2026? Leave your thoughts down in the comments below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

item.title: Borderlands 4 2026 Roadmap Revealed By Gearbox
item.content:encoded:
The Borderlands 4 roadmap has been updated, including a free content update that drops today, January 29.

Gearbox has updated the roadmap for Borderlands 4 content scheduled for release in 2026. The releases begin with a major free content update that adds photo mode to the game. In photo mode, players can adjust the field of view, field, and screen options when taking photos on either PC, Xbox, or PlayStation 5. Fans can learn more about the filters and the photo mode function at this link.

More News on the Updates Coming to Borderlands 4 in 2026

In the first quarter of 2026, both free and paid updates will be available for the game. For paid DLC, players will get the second Bounty pack, the Legend of the Stone Demon, along with a free content release with the Pearlescent Rarity.

Later in the quarter, players will receive access to the first Story pack update, named “Mad Ellie and the Vault of the Damned.” This will introduce an all-new region of Kairos, new story missions, and the first new Vault Hunter for Borderlands 4, C4SH.

In the second quarter of 2026, there are more Bounty pack updates and story updates coming. The Borderlands team notes that the most difficult endgame Mission yet will be a new takedown. The Takedown is promised to be a challenging gauntlet, including a new arena and new bosses.

Additionally, level caps will increase, shared progression will be introduced, and cross-platform saves will be added to the game as part of quality-of-life updates.

How do you feel about the changes coming to Borderlands 4? Sound off in our official Discord server.

For more Borderlands, check out the supposed release date for Borderlands 4 on the Nintendo Switch 2. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Paradox Reports 162% Quarterly Loss as Bloodlines 2 Write-Downs Hit Hard
item.content:encoded:
Paradox Interactive’s fourth quarter showed a sharp swing in profits. Revenue increased 23% from last year to roughly $99 million (MSEK 874.8), supported by sales from Age of Wonders 4, Cities: Skylines II, Crusader Kings III, and new releases Europa Universalis V and Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2.

Even with higher revenue, however, the company reported an operating loss of about $28 million (MSEK 245.4 , which is a 162% drop compared to last year. The main reason is Bloodlines 2, which did not meet sales expectations.

Paradox recorded write-downs and amortization of more than $77 million related to the game. That pushed the quarter from profitable to a significant loss.

Profit after tax fell to approximately $22 million, down from around $34 million last year. Earnings per share also turned negative, reflecting the impact of the Bloodlines 2 accounting adjustments.

Despite the hefty loss, Paradox remains financially stable. Cash flow from operations was about $56 million and the company ended the quarter with roughly $151 million in cash. That gives it room to invest in future projects and manage ongoing operations.

“We are now strengthening our strategic focus, reallocating resources, and creating even better conditions for future investments where we have our greatest expertise and long-term potential,” CEO Fred Wester said.

For the full year, sales were largely unchanged at about $241 million, while operating profit dropped 80% to $16 million. Earnings per share fell from SEK 5.54 ($0.63) to just SEK 1.19 ($0.13).

The company also launched Europa Universalis V, which the CEO described as an important step for the franchise. Paradox continued to release DLC and remasters for other titles throughout the quarter. The board proposed an ordinary dividend of 5 dollars per share, showing confidence in the underlying business despite the large quarterly loss.
